CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Sep. 24, 1955, pg. 6 reads: "Scholarship Winners - Six District boys and girls were awarded State Senatorial Scholarships at a dinner and dance and testimonial to David E. Glavin, deputy secretary of Labor and Industry for Pennsylvania, which was held at the Hotel William Penn, Saturday night...Miss Burleigh is the first Negro to win one of the scholarships during the four years that the CLU has sponsored the contest...at the speakers' table: State Senator "Barney" McGinnis, who, with Miss Burleigh, the winner in his district, led the procession into the ballroom, and the Rev. Charles O. Rice, pastor, St. Joseph Church, Natrona...Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: State Senator "Barney" McGinnis, Betty Lou Burleigh, and Reverend Charles O. Rice, seated at table in William Penn Hotel for scholarship banquet
